title: Compiler bug in simd intrinsics for usize types

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-mentor
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue has a mentor. Use RustcContributor::new on Zulip for discussion.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body: As far as I can tell this bug only exists when performing a simd gather instruction on a slice of usize. If the slice is instead typed as u64 or u32 this code succeeds. ### Code ```Rust #![feature(portable_simd)] use core_simd::Simd; fn main() { let indexes: [usize; 4] = [0, 1, 2, 3]; let simd_indexes: Simd = Simd::from_array(indexes); let slice: [usize; 4] = [10, 11, 12, 13]; let result = Simd::gather_or_default(&slice, simd_indexes); assert_eq!(result, Simd::from_array([10, 11, 12, 13])); } ``` Cargo.toml ```toml [package] name = "simd-repro" version = "0.1.0" edition = "2021" # See more keys and their definitions at https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/manifest.html [dependencies] core_simd = { git = "https://github.com/rust-lang/portable-simd", rev = "c2f59483f96cf1ab1e92cf10e0f9094432a8374c" } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.57.0-nightly (ac2d9fc50
